title: No Waqf appointment, status quo till next hearing, says SC - Key takeaways
content: The Supreme Court has temporarily suspended key provisions of the Waqf Act, directing the government to maintain the status quo until the next hearing. This decision comes amid challenges to the Act's constitutional validity, with concerns raised about the registration of waqfs by user and potential impacts on existing properties.

title: 'Vacate PoK': India hits back after Pak army chief rakes up two-nation theory
content: India strongly refuted Pakistan's "two-nation" theory, asserting that Pakistan's sole connection to India is the liberation of illegally occupied territories. This response followed Pakistan's army chief's endorsement of the theory, emphasizing fundamental differences between Hindus and Muslims. Assam's Chief Minister reacted by stressing the need to strengthen India's nationhood, dharma, and civilizational values.

title: After 'too slow' sledging , Jaiswal, Starc's chatter goes viral – Watch
content: After a thrilling IPL match between Delhi Capitals and Rajasthan Royals, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Mitchell Starc shared a friendly moment. This contrasted their earlier sledging incident during a Test series. Jaiswal asked Starc about his Delhi experience. Both players previously played for Kolkata Knight Riders. Their sportsmanship is being praised by fans. The moment highlights respect in cricket.

title: National Herald case: BJP calls Sonia, Rahul Gandhi 'dacoits'
content: BJP leader Sambit Patra has intensified the attack on Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, labeling the National Herald case a "robbery" rather than money laundering. He accused them of being "modern dacoits" involved in a blatant robbery. This statement follows the Enforcement Directorate's chargesheet against them and others in connection with the case, scheduled for court arguments on April 25.

title: Putin to students: 'You know, there's a person named Elon Musk...'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has lauded Elon Musk, comparing him to Sergei Korolev, a key figure in the Soviet space program. Putin admires Musk's ambitious vision, particularly his Mars colonization goals, despite geopolitical tensions. Musk's controversial statements on global affairs, especially regarding Ukraine, have drawn criticism amid his role in satellite communications.

title: How 18-yo Suruchi Singh became India's new shooting sensation
content: Suruchi Singh, coached by Suresh Singh, achieved remarkable success in shooting. She won multiple gold medals at national and international events, including the ISSF World Cup. Her discipline and determination, instilled by her coach, transformed her into a sharpshooter. Suruchi balances her shooting career with helping her family on their farm in Jhajjar.

title: Sensex zooms 1,509 pts, Nifty up 414: 5 reasons behind the rally
content: Indian benchmark indices surged for the fourth consecutive session, with the Sensex soaring over 1,500 points and the Nifty50 closing above 23,850. The rally was fueled by strong buying in financial stocks, driven by positive sentiment from US-Japan trade talks and weakening dollar.

title: China’s Shein, Temu to lose key US advantage starting April 25
content: Shein and Temu are poised to increase prices in the US market starting April 25 due to new trade policies enacted by former President Trump. These policies include a significant tariff on Chinese goods and the elimination of the duty-free exemption for low-value imports, impacting their business model.

title: Good Friday 2025: History, significance and all you need to know
content: Good Friday, observed on April 18, 2025, is a solemn Christian holiday commemorating Jesus Christ's crucifixion and death. Rooted in the New Testament accounts of Pontius Pilate's judgment and Jesus' sacrifice, it signifies love, salvation, and reconciliation. Across the globe, Christians attend special services, abstain from meat, and participate in processions.

title: VP Dhankhar takes on SC over deadline for President to decide on bills
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar has criticized the Supreme Court's directive setting a timeline for the President to decide on bills, arguing it undermines the constitutional role of the office. He questioned the judiciary's authority to issue such directives, emphasizing the President's immunity from prosecution.

title: NEET PG registration 2025 begins: Direct link, important dates and key details here
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has opened NEET PG 2025 registration from April 17, with the last date to apply set for May 7. The exam will be held on June 15 in two shifts. The official information bulletin, detailing the syllabus and eligibility, will be available from 3 PM today.

title: Results of paternity test of Ashley St Clair's son out: How lab 'confirmed' it
content: Elon Musk has been confirmed as the father of Ashley St. Clair's son, Romulus, through a paternity test. St. Clair initially kept the birth private to protect their child, but recent media attention prompted her to reveal Musk as the father.

title: Haunting image of boy maimed in Gaza war wins World Press Photo award
content: A poignant image of nine-year-old Mahmoud Ajjour, who lost both arms in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza, has been awarded the 2025 World Press Photo of the Year. Samar Abu Elouf's photograph captures Mahmoud's resilience as he adapts to life in Doha, learning to navigate daily tasks with his feet. The image symbolizes the profound and lasting impact of war on individuals and future generations.

title: Stock market today: Sensex closes 1500 points up; Nifty near 23,850
content: Indian markets experienced a downturn on Thursday, ending a week-long upward trend, with Sensex and Nifty plunging in early trade. This decline occurred despite positive closes on Wednesday. The downturn contrasts with gains in most Asian markets, which were influenced by US-Japan trade talks.

title: 6 dead as autorickshaw crashes into bus in Gujarat
content: A tragic collision between an autorickshaw and a state transport bus in Gujarat's Patan district claimed the lives of six individuals on Thursday. The accident occurred near Sami village on the Sami-Radhanpur highway. Preliminary investigations suggest the bus driver lost control while attempting to overtake, leading to the fatal impact.

title: 'Wanted family's attention': Man tries to poison students at Telangana school, held
content: Soyam Kistu, frustrated by family neglect, allegedly contaminated mid-day meal utensils at a school in Adilabad. Principal Pratibha discovered the chemical laced utensils and alerted the police. Authorities arrested Kistu, who confessed to the crime. He wanted to grab his family's attention through this act. Police registered a case and investigation is underway. Kistu is now in judicial custody.

title: How BluSmart affects daily commuting in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai and Bengaluru
content: BluSmart, the EV ride-hailing service, abruptly suspended operations in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, and Bengaluru, leaving commuters stranded and drivers in limbo. This disruption follows regulatory action by SEBI against BluSmart's promoter company, Gensol Engineering, due to alleged fund diversions and governance lapses.

title: Indian national’s US visa denied in 40 seconds. What went wrong in 3 questions?
content: An Indian national's US B1/B2 visa application was swiftly denied after a brief interview, sparking online discussion. The applicant, planning a Florida vacation, was rejected due to lack of travel history and having a girlfriend in the US, raising concerns about potential overstay. Reddit users suggest building a travel record and being cautious about revealing personal connections during interviews.

title: Gujarat teen’s suicide uncovers child marriage; parents, in-laws booked
content: The suicide of a 17-year-old girl in Kheda has uncovered a child marriage case, leading to charges against both sets of parents under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act. Investigations revealed that Jankikumari Chunara and her husband, Anand, were underage at the time of their marriage in March 2023.

title: Meerut woman kills husband, tries to pass it off as death by snake bite
content: In Meerut, Amit Kashyap was found dead. Initial reports suggested snake bites. Post-mortem revealed strangulation. His wife, Ravita, confessed to plotting the murder with her lover, Amardeep. Ravita had an affair with Amardeep. Amit discovered their relationship, leading to disputes. Ravita strangled Amit and placed a snake to fake the cause of death.

title: Abhishek Nayar sacked? BCCI secretary Saikia says ...
content: Abhishek Nayar was appointed the side's assistant coach under head coach Gautam Gambhir just eight months ago but reports suggest his tenure has come to an abrupt end. The Indian cricket board beefed up the coaching staff when Sitanshu Kotak was roped in as the batting coach earlier this year but Nayar continued to be with the team, and both were part of the change room during the Champions Trophy campaign in Dubai.

title: India's FY25 trade surplus with US grows, deficit with China widens
content: India's trade dynamics reveal a shifting landscape, with the US emerging as a key partner, marked by increased exports and a growing trade surplus. Conversely, the trade deficit with China has widened significantly due to decreased exports, particularly in ore, and a surge in imports. This reflects changing global trade patterns and India's evolving export destinations.

title: First Indian American councillor Ashfaq Syed gets strong desi backing in Naperville
content: Ashfaq Syed made history as the first Indian American elected to the Naperville City Council. Driven by a commitment to community service, Syed aims to represent the city's diversity and address key issues like responsible development and public safety. Supported by the local Indian American community, his victory highlights the growing civic engagement of this demographic in Naperville.

title: Tunnel collapse: Telangana may declare 6 missing workers 'presumed dead' if not found
content: Telangana government is set to conclude rescue efforts at Srisailam Left Bank Canal. This follows a roof collapse two months ago. Six missing workers may be declared presumed dead. A technical committee will explore further rescue options. Difficult conditions hampered the search. Agencies will stop if they do not find the missing persons.

title: 'Repeated questions': Robert Vadra after day 3 of ED grilling
content: Robert Vadra faced interrogation by the Enforcement Directorate regarding alleged irregularities in a land deal. Vadra claimed repeated questioning and a potential birthday celebration at the ED office. The Bharatiya Janata Party criticized the Gandhi family over the case. They alleged illicit enrichment of the family's treasury.

title: 'Height of arrogance': BJP slams DMK for placing temple 'gopuram' on Karuna memorial
content: Narayanan Thirupathy, Tamil Nadu BJP vice president, has strongly condemned the DMK government for erecting a temple-style gopuram over M. Karunanidhi's burial site at Marina Beach. He criticized the move as an affront to Hindu beliefs, asserting that a burial place is unsuitable for a temple structure. Thirupathy warned that disrespecting Hindu sentiments would have political repercussions for the DMK.

title: Why social media is praising JK Rowling after UK top court’s trans ruling
content: The UK Supreme Court's ruling, defining "woman" in the Equality Act as biological female, has sparked widespread support for JK Rowling, a vocal gender-critical feminist. Rowling celebrated the decision, which rejected a broader definition including transgender women, igniting a debate about gender identity and sex-based rights.

title: When MS Dhoni changed CSK's team hotel over 'food delivery'
content: Dwayne Smith revealed MS Dhoni's rare display of anger, citing an incident where Dhoni moved hotels due to a food delivery issue. Smith also recalled Dhoni's displeasure when Ashwin dropped a catch. Dhoni produced a vintage finishing act, smashing an unbeaten 26 to guide Chennai Super Kings to a five-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants on Monday.

title: What is 'waqf by user' and why was it flagged by Supreme Court?
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Centre's move to remove 'waqf by user' from the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, fearing the erasure of longstanding religious properties. The court raised concerns about properties lacking formal documents and the exclusion of non-Muslims from waqf boards.

title: UP women who eloped with daughter’s fiancé returns days before wedding
content: In Aligarh, a 40-year-old woman and her daughter's 20-year-old fiancé, who eloped with Rs 2.5 lakh in cash and jewellery just days before the wedding, have been taken into custody. Police investigations, including CCTV footage analysis and call detail records, led to their apprehension after a missing complaint was filed by the woman's husband.

title: Rs 43 crore flat, Rs 26 lakh golf sets: How BluSmart promoters 'diverted' EV funds
content: Sebi's investigation reveals Gensol Engineering promoters, Anmol and Puneet Jaggi, diverted company funds for personal enrichment, including luxury purchases and stock manipulation. They misused loans, forged documents, and misled regulators. Funds were used to buy a luxury flat and inflate Gensol's stock price through artificial trading.

title: Tesla on Indian roads! 2025 Model Y spotted testing near Mumbai: Launch soon?
content: Tesla's entry into the Indian EV market seems imminent as the updated 2025 Model Y, codenamed Juniper, was spotted testing on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway. This facelifted version boasts design tweaks like C-shaped LED taillights and a long-range battery offering 526 km. The Model Y could be the first Tesla vehicle to launch in India, featuring a 15.

title: Tragedy of errors: Rajasthan doctors operate on father instead of injured son
content: In a shocking incident at Kota Medical College, Rajasthan, a man named Manish alleges that doctors mistakenly operated on his paralysed father instead of him. Manish, injured in an accident, had called his father for support before his scheduled surgery. He was stunned to discover his father, waiting outside the operation theatre, had undergone a procedure and received stitches.

title: Starc stunned by Dravid and Samson's unexpected decision
content: Mitchell Starc's exceptional death bowling, conceding only eight runs in the final over, forced a Super Over against Rajasthan Royals, which Delhi Capitals ultimately won. Starc's composure and execution under pressure earned him Player of the Match. He also acknowledged a bit of luck and praised the team's balanced dynamics and leadership.

title: How one of India’s biggest jobs scandals was executed
content: The Calcutta High Court and Supreme Court invalidated the 2016 West Bengal School Selection Commission recruitment process due to widespread manipulation. Approximately 25,000 teaching and non-teaching staff appointments were cancelled, revealing a scam involving manipulated mark sheets, rank jumping, and appointments of ineligible candidates. Investigations exposed destroyed records and the creation of supernumerary posts to accommodate fraudulent appointments.

title: Who is Indian-origin scientist behind the discovery of life 120 light-yrs away?
content: Dr. Nikku Madhusudhan, an Indian-origin astrophysicist, leads a team that has found compelling evidence of biological activity on exoplanet K2-18b, 120 light-years away. Using the James Webb Space Telescope, they detected dimethyl sulfide (DMS), a molecule only produced by living organisms on Earth. This revolutionary discovery marks the first potential biosignature detection on a habitable planet.

title: CBI raids AAP leader Durgesh Pathak's house in FCRA violation case
content: The CBI has initiated searches at the premises of AAP leader Durgesh Pathak, who is also the 2027 Gujarat assembly poll in-charge, concerning a case registered under the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA).

title: Surrounded by security, Dhoni stops everything for a fan
content: MS Dhoni's humility shone once again as he paused amidst security to pose for a photo with a wheelchair-bound fan at the airport. This heartwarming gesture followed CSK's crucial victory against LSG, where Dhoni's explosive batting secured the win. Dhoni also addressed the need for improved batting pitches at Chepauk to boost the team's confidence.

title: Dog’s teeth yanked out with pliers; pups & mom beaten to death in MP
content: Reports emerged from Bhind and Morena about animal cruelty. In Bhind, a dog was tortured and killed. The attackers even pulled out its teeth. In Morena, a woman and her son killed a dog and her puppies. Videos of both incidents circulated online. Police have registered cases against the accused under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act.

title: Who is DJ Vasi Sachi? Meet Priyanka Deshpande’s second husband
content: Priyanka Deshpande, the popular television presenter, joyfully announced her second marriage to DJ Vasi Sachi on April 16, 2025. The intimate ceremony, attended by close friends and family, marks a new chapter for Priyanka. Their love story reportedly began at one of Vasi's events, evolving from a professional acquaintance to a deep connection, culminating in their marriage.

title: 'Victim' Ashneer Grover defends Rs 1.5 cr Blusmart investment
content: Ashneer Grover, BharatPe's co-founder, claims to be a 'victim' after SEBI's action against Gensol Engineering and BluSmart's operational halt. Grover invested ₹1.5 crore in BluSmart and ₹25 lakh in Matrix. He clarified he has no operational role and offered to reveal his financial details to prove legitimacy.

title: Can Muslims be governed by Indian succession law instead of Shariat? SC to examine
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to review whether Muslims can choose Indian succession law over Sharia for ancestral property matters without abandoning their faith. Notices have been issued to the Centre and Kerala government, seeking their responses to a petition filed by a Kerala resident.

title: CIA files reveal Cold War plots with mind control, fake porn & psychic tests
content: Declassified CIA documents reveal bizarre Cold War operations, including psychological warfare tactics like oversized condoms and a demonic Osama Bin Laden action figure. The agency also explored mind control through Project MKUltra, involving unethical experiments on humans and even dogs.

title: Klay exorcises 'demons' as Mavericks oust Kings
content: Klay Thompson's performance Wednesday was in stark contrast to last season's play-in flop and helped the Mavericks eliminate the Kings for a shot at the West's final playoff berth.

title: Sources: McNair out as Kings GM after play-in loss
content: Monte McNair is out as Kings general manager following the team's season-ending loss to the Mavericks on Wednesday night in the play-in tournament, sources told ESPN.

title: Serena: I'd get 20-year ban if caught like Sinner
content: American great Serena Williams said she would have been banned for 20 years and stripped of her Grand Slam titles had she failed drug tests like men's world number one Jannik Sinner did last year.

title: Van Dijk signs contract extension at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has signed a contract extension putting an end to speculation over whether this season would be his last at Anfield.

title: Sources: UCLA among schools eyeing Iamaleava
content: UCLA has had conversations with representatives of transfer quarterback Nico Iamaleava for less money than he was asking for from Tennessee, sources told ESPN on Wednesday.

title: Sources: QB Browne among UNC players to portal
content: North Carolina quarterback Ryan Browne is among the Tar Heels entering the transfer portal, sources said Wednesday, as is sacks leader Beau Atkinson.

title: Reigning champ Gators land ex-Princeton star Lee
content: Princeton transfer Xaivian Lee, one of the top point guards in the transfer portal, has picked newly crowned champion Florida over St. John's and Kansas, he announced.

title: NBA postseason preview: Stars, matchups and X factors that could decide the champion
content: Everything you need to know about the teams battling it out in the postseason, including first-round matchups.

title: 'I know how badly they want to win': How the Senators grew into being a playoff team
content: Ottawa is back in the postseason for the first time since 2017 -- with plans to make it an annual occurrence.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: How Paul Skenes is growing into life as MLB's next megastar
content: Amid the noise that comes with achieving superstar status, the Pirates ace finds himself in the quiet.

title: Bontemps' ballot: Final selections for MVP, All-NBA and every award
content: Who is the MVP? The top rookie? The Defensive Player of the Year? Tim Bontemps reveals his official awards ballot.

title: CFB spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content: The spring transfer period is open. Nico Iamaleava and Gio Lopez are among the top players available.

title: Why Shedeur Sanders' NFL draft process, stardom are like nothing we've seen before
content: Too confident? Too famous? Here's what former Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders faced and why he's sure he'll succeed.

title: 'She can carry a franchise': What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? WNBA GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: Inter use grit to reach Champions League semis, but they must be better vs. Barcelona
content: Inter qualified for the UEFA Champions League semifinals, but can they improve to eliminate a tough Barcelona side and make it to the final?

title: Ancelotti: Madrid future in doubt after UCL exit
content: Carlo Ancelotti said he "doesn't know" if Real Madrid's 2-1 Champions League defeat to Arsenal on Wednesday was his last game in charge of Madrid in the competition.

title: Arsenal deliver 'proudest night' for Arteta vs. Real
content: Mikel Arteta is targeting Champions League glory after celebrating his "proudest night" as Arsenal manager on Wednesday as the Gunners knocked out holders Real Madrid to reach their first semifinal since 2009.

title: Neymar exits in tears after fresh injury setback
content: Neymar suffered a fresh injury setback when the Brazil star was forced to leave Santos' match with Atlético-MG due to a left thigh injury.

title: Kompany: Injuries were 'big issue' in Bayern exit
content: Bayern Munich earned a draw at the San Siro against Inter Milan on Wednesday but ultimately bowed out of the Champions League, leaving manager Vincent Kompany to reflect on the injury crisis that hit his side ahead of the quarter-final.

title: Madrid fans boo as Mbappé exits loss with injury
content: Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappé injured his right ankle in Real Madrid's 2-1 loss to Arsenal in the quarterfinals of the Champions League on Wednesday

title: Inter setting no limits with treble dream still alive
content: With a treble still on the cards, Inter Milan are not setting themselves any limits after beating Bayern Munich to advance to the Champions League semifinals.

title: Ex-MLS forward dies following fall from 11th floor
content: Gabon forward Aaron Boupendza has died at 28 following a fall from the 11th floor of a building in China, the Gabonese Football Federation has said.

title: Tevez targets Ronaldo, Messi for farewell game
content: Carlos Tevez wants former teammates Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to take part in his farewell game in Buenos Aires.

title: What comes next for the flailing Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading Kevin Durant.

title: Surprise teams, contenders and OU's quest to five-peat: Big questions for the rest of the softball season
content: Is anyone outpitching NiJaree Canady? Which teams are serious contenders? Bill Connelly dives into the 2025 college softball season thus far.

title: Previewing the NCAA gymnastics championships
content: Can LSU defend its title? Or will OU get redemption? What to watch as the NCAA gymnastics championships begin Thursday.

title: 2025-26 Way-Too-Early Top 25: Teams on the rise in version 2.0
content: Texas Tech and BYU climb our Way-Too-Early 2025-26 rankings thanks to key player returns and portal additions.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to replace Onana with Santos?
content: Eintracht Frankfurt goalkeeper Kauã Santos could replace Manchester United's André Onana in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who earned a spot, Volkanovski or Jandiroba?
content: There's a new featherweight champion and new strawweight No. 1 contender -- but just one is in ESPN's top 10.

title: Who will new featherweight champ Volkanovski fight in first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility?

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: Adani Group Yoga Instructor Smita Kumari Breaks Another Guinness World Record
content: Smita Kumari, a yoga instructor at Adani Group, has made history by setting her second Guinness World Record.

title: "Working Closely With Belgium": Foreign Ministry On Mehul Choksi's Extradition
content: India on Thursday said it is working closely with Belgium for extradition of fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi.

title: Naveen Patnaik Files Nomination For BJD President Post For 9th Consecutive Term
content: Odisha's former Chief Minister and Biju Janata Dal (BJD) supremo Naveen Patnaik on Thursday filed his nomination for the post of BJD president, marking his bid for a ninth consecutive term.

title: "Won't Allow Attempt To Hindi-fy All": Raj Thackeray Slams Three-Language Policy
content: The "Hindi imposition" row has spread from the south to Maharashtra, with Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray, in a post on X, slamming the Centre's three-language policy.

title: Tale Of 2 'Jagdishes': Hospital Mix-Up Could Have Led To Unwanted Surgery
content: A 60-year-old man attending to his injured son at a Rajasthan government hospital almost had a surprise operation, thanks to his name. Jagdish's son Manish was admitted to the Government Medical College in Kota after an accident

title: Meerut Woman, Lover Murder Her Husband, Get Snake To Bite Body In Cover-Up Attempt
content: A woman and her lover murdered her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut and then left a snake near his body to have the reptile's bites cover up their crime.

title: "Sense Of Relief": Mamata Banerjee Welcomes Top Court Order On Sacked Teachers
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday welcomed the Supreme Court's order extending the services of untainted teachers whose appointments were earlier terminated, stating that there was now a "sense of relief".

title: No Provocative Speeches Allowed: High Court On Bengal Waqf Violence
content: The Calcutta High Court on Thursday directed the central forces to stay put in violence-hit Murshidabad district of West Bengal, where protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act turned violent last week.

title: "Kashmir's Only Relation With Pakistan...": India On Pak Army Chief's "Jugular Vein" Remark
content: India has rubbished comments by the Pakistani army chief who claimed Kashmir was Islamabad's "jugular vein".

title: "His Termination Can't Come Fast Enough": Trump On US Federal Reserve Chief
content: US President Donald Trump blasted Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell on Thursday for not lowering interest rates, calling him "always TOO LATE AND WRONG".

title: "No Misleading Claims, Guaranteeing Success": Centre To Coaching Centres
content: The government has ordered coaching centres not to make misleading claims, assure guaranteed success, and hide key information from consumers amid a flood of complaints from students and parents over unethical practices.

title: 21 Acres For 99 Paise: Andhra Pradesh Allocates Land To TCS In Visakhapatnam
content: The Andhra Pradesh Cabinet on Tuesday approved the allocation of 21.16 acres to TCS in Visakhapatnam at a token lease price of 99 paise.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Karnataka Caste Survey Highlights Risks of Rahul's Woo OBC Strategy
content: Political analysts have questioned the timing of the survey, suggesting that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's real intent may be to weaken the bargaining power of influential community leaders within the Congress.

title: Situation Under Control In Murshidabad: Bengal Government Tells High Court
content: The West Bengal government on Thursday submitted a report before the Calcutta High Court and claimed that the law and order situation in violence-hit Murshidabad district was under control.

title: BluSmart Stops Cab Bookings: Here's How To Reclaim Blu Cab Wallet Balance
content: Electric cab service BluSmart, once a potential competitor to giants such as Uber and Ola, has suspended its services in Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru and Mumbai.

title: US Airlines Plane's Engine Bursts Into Flames Mid-Air After 'Rabbit Strike'
content: A United Airlines plane was forced to make an emergency landing after one of its engines burst into flames due to a rare rabbit strike.

title: Kidnapped By Hamas, Pet Dog Reunited With Israeli Family After 18 Months
content: Rachel Dancyg was overcome with emotion as she embraced her three-year-old Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, Billy

title: Recruitment scam: SC allows Bengal govt to retain 'untainted' teachers for now
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: "Nuclear Missile Against...": Vice-President's All-Out Attack On Top Court
content: "Can't Direct President Of India": Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar Attacks Judiciary After Supreme Court Verdict

title: "The News Hits Hard": Internet Reacts To BluSmart Shutting Down Amid SEBI Order
content: BluSmart remained non-operational across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru and Mumbai, as SEBI cracked down on its co-founder over alleged misuse of funds at an affiliated company.

title: Karnataka Caste Survey | The complete coverage
content: The 50-volume report is derived out of the data collected during the survey conducted by the commission headed by H. Kantharaj in 2015, at the cost of ₹192 crore, but submitted by his successor K. Jayaprakash Hegde in 2024.

title: Why no FIR in burnt cash discovery at judge's house case, questions Vice-President Dhankhar
content: Mr. Dhankhar also questioned the legal standing of the three-judge panel carrying out an in-house probe into the matter

title: Karbi Anglong moves towards development from insurgency: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma also met with representatives of the six outfits that had signed the peace accord and reviewed the terms of the settlement

title: T.N. government to address wage issues of powerloom weavers: Ministers in Assembly
content: They were responding to a special calling attention motion moved by Leader of the Opposition Edappadi K. Palaniswami, who sought the immediate intervention of the State government in the issue

title: L&T and NCC Ltd. to construct Legislative Assembly and High Court buildings
content: L&T emerged as the lowest bidder for the construction of the Legislative Assembly building by quoting a sum of approximately ₹617.40 crore

title: MMRDA successfully completed ‘breakthrough’ of underground tunnel in Metro Route 7A
content: Metro line will provide connectivity to the international airport from Mira Bhayandar (Metro Line 9) area and Western Suburb a (Metro Line 2A and Metro Line 7), once operational.

title: Consumer Protection Authority warns coaching centres against misleading ads ahead of IIT-JEE results
content: CCPA warns coaching centres against misleading ads ahead of IIT-JEE results, enforces strict guidelines and penalties

title: Madras HC judge questions T.N. Minister Ponmudy over derogatory remarks against women, religious sects
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh asks Advocate General P.S. Raman to take instructions from the DGP by Thursday evening regarding the steps taken so far against the Minister

title: Shortage of firefighting vehicles in Shivamogga
content: According to officials, two vehicles each in Shivamogga and Sorab, one each in Sagar, Shikaripur and Hosanagar, have been scrapped as they are older than 15 years

title: 1,800 kg of banned plastic seized from Alappuzha market in Kerala
content: Prohibited plastic items, including straws, glasses and banana leaves, confiscated from an establishment in Vazhichery market

title: Situation under control in violence-hit Murshidabad: Bengal govt to Cal HC
content: The lawyer appearing for the Centre prayed before the court that the deployment of CAPF in Murshidabad be extended for a further period of time

title: ED denies alleged human rights violations at TASMAC headquarters during search operation
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar say they will reserve their judgment on Monday after hearing the arguments of TASMAC

title: Hyderabad’s Tarnaka junction to reopen for trial run from April 18
content: Certain restrictions will remain in place: vehicles from Habsiguda not allowed to turn right towards Lalapet and vehicles approaching from Mettuguda not permitted to turn right towards O.U.

title: SC mulls inquiry panel for 'deeper' probe into affairs of sports bodies
content: A bench was hearing a plea of two national Kabaddi players in which it had previously sought views for a CBI probe into the affairs of the Amateur Kabaddi Federation of India (AKFI) and the International Kabaddi Federation.

title: Gadkari to unveil highway projects worth ₹4,000 crore in Odisha
content: The Union Minister will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of 19 national highway projects worth ₹4,000 crore during a public meeting at Baramunda Maidan in Bhubaneswar

title: Waqf Act: NDA leaders slam Mamata Banerjee for remark against Nitish Kumar, Chandrababu Naidu
content: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said, "Mamata Banerjee has no right to make such comments against Nitish Kumar. She has failed to control violence in Murshidabad"

title: Renovation of Tholkappiya Poonga set to be completed by April-end: Minister
content: After the DMK assumed office, ₹42.45 crore was allocated to restore the park and enhance its infrastructure, K.N. Nehru said

title: Did not write that Farooq supported Article 370 abrogation, says former RAW chief Dulat amid controversial claims in new book
content: Dulat says his new book, ‘The Chief Minister and the Spy’, is not about Article 370, but rather “an appreciation of Farooq Abdullah, the great man”

title: Rumours of possible abrupt closure of FIIT-JEE coaching center in Vijayawada triggers unrest among students and parents
content: Parents who were contacted by other tutorial centers fuelled fears about the continuation of the center

title: Existing waqfs, registered or declared, shall not be denotified till next hearing: Supreme Court
content: The Bench also got an assurance from the Union Government that no appointments would be made under Sections 9, 14 of the Waqf Act, which pertains to appointment of non-Muslims in the Waqf Board.

title: Election rules row: SC allows 3 weeks to EC to respond to plea of Jairam Ramesh, others
content: The petitioners have said the amendments to the 1961 Conduct of Election Rules were made "very cleverly" and barred any access to CCTV footage claiming it would reveal the identity of the voter

title: Supreme Court relief to ‘untainted’ Bengal teachers, directs fresh recruitment process to be completed by December 31
content: The Bench ordered the State Government and secondary school education authorities to file an affidavit before May 31, enclosing the advertisement and a schedule of the entire recruitment process till December 31

title: Gold continues to glitter for 2nd day; hit fresh peak of ₹95,935/10 g
content: Gold prices hit record high on Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) as a result of firm demand, uncertainty surrounding the U.S. trade policy, and waning demand for the dollar

title: Report on authenticity of audio clips on Biren Singh's role in Manipur violence ready: Centre to SC
content: Earlier, the Supreme Court sought a sealed-cover forensic report from the CFSL on the authenticity of the leaked audio clips alleging Mr. Singh's role in the ethnic violence that began in May 2023

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates Sify’s AI-ready data centre campus in Siruseri
content: This is South India’s largest AI-ready data centre campus, which has an eventual capacity of 130 MW. It is also the only data centre in India with an on-site open cable landing station, the company said

title: Naveen Patnaik files nomination paper for BJD president's post for ninth time
content: Naveen Patnaik files nomination for BJD president, highlighting achievements and defending history against detractors

title: Meeting with 16th Finance Commission Chairman and members was highly productive: Pawan Kalyan
content: He stated that the Gram Panchayats are paving the way for Swarna Andhra Pradesh, and they are being transformed into engines of growth

title: Devgiri fort fire: Don't allow visitors to carry flammable items, says INTACH
content: In its memorandum, the INTACH claimed that grass grown on the terrace of the Baradari (located on the fort's topmost portion), had caught fire, which then spread to the wooden structures

title: Grenade hurling at Punjab YouTuber's home: Army jawan held for training accused
content: Army jawan Sukhcharan Singh, who was posted in Jammu and Kashmir, has been arrested for allegedly providing online training to the accused on throwing hand grenade

title: Rahul slams govt over 'inhumane' working conditions of loco pilots
content: Mr. Gandhi also shared a media report on X which claimed that Railways rejected the demand for a break and women staff were quoted as saying that they had to do eight hours duty without a toilet facility

title: Rural areas in T.N. set for changes in property tax administration
content: On an experimental basis, 148 village panchayats (VP) were identified for the assessment of properties on the basis of plinth area, as provided in the Tamil Nadu Panchayats Act, 1994, against the practice of assessment on a flat rate basis

title: Mahadev App case: EaseMyTrip denies association with Mahadev betting app
content: The Enforcement Directorate on April 16 searched the premises of online travel booking portal EaseMyTrip’s co-founder Nishant Pitti as part of fresh multi-state raids in the Mahadev online betting app linked money laundering case, officials said.

title: SC directs states, UTs to develop swift response protocols for road accident victims
content: A Bench of Justices Abhay Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan also directed  the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways to convene meetings of departments concerned of States and UTs to implement working hours of drivers

title: Chittoor woman who married against family’s wishes found dead after she visited her marital home; ‘honour’ killing suspected
content: Though family members claim that their daughter died by ending her life, police are awaiting the post-mortem examination report to ascertain the cause of death and the possibility of honour killing

title: Minor dalit girl raped in UP's Rampur
content: FIR has been registered on a complaint from the rape survivor, the officer said, adding that three teams have been formed by the superintendent of police to work out the case.

title: RJD MLA Ritlal Yadav wanted in extortion case surrenders before Bihar court
content: I am a victim of a political conspiracy... There is a threat to my life... I might be killed. If I remain alive, I will file papers seeking bail. There are certain officials who are against me, says RJD MLA Ritlal Yadav

title: Who is Chinmay Deore, the Indian student who filed lawsuit against U.S. Department of Homeland Security
content: According to the lawsuit, none of the students has engaged in any criminal activity, violated immigration laws, or participated in political demonstrations

title: Brother-in-law of Coimbatore pastor John Jebaraj arrested for sexual assault on minor girl
content: According to the police, the girl’s statement was recorded by a judicial officer after Jebaraj was arrested from Munnar on April 12

title: Supreme Court to examine whether Muslims can be governed by succession law instead of Shariat
content: A Bench took note of a plea filed by a resident of Kerala that he wanted to be governed by the succession law instead of Shariat without leaving Islam as his religion

title: After 22 months, Droupadi Amman temple in Villupuram village reopened for public worship amid tight security
content: The temple was closed due to persistent tensions between caste Hindus and Dalits over the latter’s entry

title: Robert Vadra appears before ED on 3rd day in Haryana land deal case
content: The case is related a land deal in Shikohpur of Gurugram done in February 2008 by a company, Skylight Hospitality, of which Mr. Vadra was earlier a director.

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit U.S., will give talk at Brown University
content: Congress' media and publicity department head Pawan Khera said Mr. Gandhi will be visiting Brown University in Rhode Island, United States, on April 21 and 22

title: Four Tamil Nadu fishermen attacked mid-sea
content: The assailants stole a GPS devicegadget, a walkie-talkie set, a few cell phones, a charge light, fishing gear, and fish worth around ₹20,000 from the four fishermen

title: Hindi now a mandatory third language in Maharashtra for classes 1-5 as it rolls out NEP 2020
content: The syllabus of the State Board will be based on the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT), having Maharashtra’s local context in subjects like History, Geography, and languages

title: CAPF, CRPF to play key role in wiping out Maoism from country by March 2026: Amit Shah
content: Before attending the ceremonial parade, Mr. Shah paid tributes to fallen heroes of the CRPF. Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav was also present on the occasion

title: JD(U) poster asserts Nitish to continue in Bihar CM's post till 2030
content: Calling for another term for the longest-serving Chief Minister of Bihar, the message on the poster blazoned: '25 se 30, phir se Nitish' (Nitish again from 2025 to 2030).

title: Army jawan held in connection with grenade attack at YouTuber’s house in Jalandhar
content: Army jawan Sukhcharan Singh, who was posted in Jammu and Kashmir, has been arrested for allegedly providing an online training to an accused for throwing a hand grenade.

title: Waqf Act hearing LIVE: Centre assures Supreme Court that no waqf properties will be denotifed till next hearing
content: The court recorded the government’s assurance that no appointments will be made to the Waqf Council or Waqf Boards until the matter is taken up next on May 5

title: CBI registers alleged FCRA violation case involving AAP’s Durgesh Pathak, conducts searches
content: The papers contained purported details shared by the ED with the Union Home Ministry on October 27, 2022, and on August 4, 2023. They alleged that AAP received foreign funds in violation of FCRA rules and other applicable legal provisions

title: Forest dept traps leopard inside ICRISAT campus on Hyderabad outskirts
content: One more leopard is suspected to be still roaming the campus. The two felines were captured on ICRISAT’s drone images recently.

title: Watch | DMK government failed to fulfil its poll promises, says Tamil Nadu BJP president Nainar Nagenthran
content: In this interview with The Hindu, State president of Tamil Nadu BJP Nainar Nagenthran talks about the party’s alliance with the AIADMK, Annamalai’s role in the party and how the party is preparing for the upcoming State Assembly elections

title: 14 held by Chhattisgarh police for betting via Mahadev app
content: Of the 14 arrested, six hail from Chhattisgarh, three from Jharkhand, two from Madhya Pradesh and one each from Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar, Raipur Range Inspector General of Police Amresh Mishra

title: How the nature of Trinamool’s leadership changed over time
content: The dominant understanding of the Trinamool Congress’ governance approach is that, in the absence of economic growth, it seeks “desirable reelectable outcomes” through welfare delivery.

title: ED chargesheets against Sonia, Rahul part of Modi-Shah’s conspiracy, say Congress leadersin A.P.
content: APCC vice-president said the Narendra Modi-Amit Shah duo were resorting to conspiracies as they were insecure about the growing popularity of the Congress

title: 110 artistes, technical experts get Kandukuri Rangasthala Awards in A.P.
content: The Nandi Awards and Nandi Theatre Festival will be organised this year, says  Minister for Tourism, Culture and Cinematography Kandula Durgesh

title: BJP welcomes Supreme Court order on Kancha Gachibowli
content: G. Kishan Reddy told that the government should at least now shed its aggressive stance, stop peddling lies and take up tree plantation in the area

title: I was pilot when development aircraft took off: Eknath Shinde
content: When a "people's government" (Mahayuti government led by him) came to power in 2022, the construction of the airport got completed speedily, says Eknath Shinde

title: IIT Bombay scientists develop lotus leaf-like solar evaporators for salt water treatment
content: A new hydrophobic graphene-based material developed by IIT Bombay scientists could support efforts to address fresh water crisis in the world.

title: DGCA may review framework for pilot fitness, other aspects
content: The plan also comes against the backdrop of the death of an Air India Express pilot due to a medical condition in the national capital earlier this month soon after operating a flight from Srinagar

title: Rishikesh-Karnaprayag rail link project: Vaishnaw witnesses breakthrough of longest rail tunnel in Uttarakhand
content: The 14.57-km-long tunnel no 8 between Devprayag and Janasu is part of the ambitious 125-km Rishikesh-Karnaprayag Broad Gauge Rail Link Project in Uttarakhand

title: Heat island push to city’s scorching summer temperature
content: Research shows that the temperature within the Urban Heat Island areas could be 3 to 5 degrees higher than the surroundings, dramatically worsening citizens’ lives

title: 16th Finance Commission team lauds WhatsApp governance model in A.P.
content: The goal is to provide up to 1,000 services through WhatsApp, Chief Minister informs the delegation

title: Amaravati needs an international airport to attract foreign investments, says Minister Narayana
content: The State government is committed to fulfilling all the promises that have been made to the farmers in the capital region, says Narayana

title: Modi will set capital construction works in motion on May 2, says Chief Secy.
content: Vijayanand said the place where Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu launched the P-4 initiative was finalised as the venue for the event

title: Got old clothes? Here’s a business card to dispose them of
content: The initiative is part of BBC Media Action’s newly launched ‘Got Old Clothes?’ campaign that aims to urge people of Bengaluru to responsibly discard their old clothes.

title: Why accused with multiple disciplinary complaints lodged with Christian Michel, Delhi Court asks police
content: The court was responding to an application filed by James, in which he requested to provide adequate security measures in the barrack. He also alleged that his tea was being poisoned and that he faced life threats.

title: Women bike taxi riders urge Karnataka transport minister to reconsider ban
content: The petition follows a Karnataka High Court directive on April 2, mandating the cessation of all bike taxi operations

title: After months of separation, Nidhi and parents reconnect through a virtual meet
content: The videoconference was arranged by the Ernakulam Town North police, who had registered a case against the girl’s parents for abandoning her shortly after her birth

title: Coastal population in Ernakulam hit by tidal flooding to get relief
content: They can now apply for relief in the prescribed pro forma to the village offices concerned. Once the applications are received, the authorities will verify them, based on which the relief will be decided

title: NBA playoffs bracket
content: Content extraction failed.

title: 3 die in boat crash at Major League Fishing event
content: a bass fishing boat struck a center console-type vessel early Wednesday morning . three people aboard the vessel were killed, and the ALEA said three more were injured . Neither the state agency nor Major League Fishing released information about what led to the crash .

title: Ian Darke's Premier League stars of the season: Salah, Isak, more
content: Mohamed Salah is currently top of the premier league with 27 goals and 18 assists through 32 games . but are there other serious contenders? you can expect Salah to collect the PFA Player of the Year award and the historic Football Writers' Association footballer of the year trophy .

title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's draft performance
content: andraya Carter is a big fan of the Washington Mystics' three first-round picks in the 2025 WNBA draft . a couple of teams have a solid chance to make the roster . there's always a chance for teams to prove these grades wrong, sometimes for better .
